channel.title: Home on Solvio - Vector Database
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Solvio - Vector Database

item.title: Data Ingestion for Beginners
item.author: info@solvio.tech (Andrey Vasnetsov)
item.description:
Send S3 Data to Solvio Vector Store with LangChain

Time: 30 min Level: Beginner

Data ingestion into a vector store is essential for building effective search and retrieval algorithms, especially since nearly 80% of data is unstructured, lacking any predefined format.

In this tutorial, we’ll create a streamlined data ingestion pipeline, pulling data directly from AWS S3 and feeding it into Solvio. We’ll dive into vector embeddings, transforming unstructured data into a format that allows you to search documents semantically. Prepare to discover new ways to uncover insights hidden within unstructured data!

item.title: Simple Agentic RAG System
item.author: info@solvio.tech (Andrey Vasnetsov)
item.description:
Agentic RAG With CrewAI & Solvio Vector Database

Time: 45 min Level: Beginner Output: GitHub

By combining the power of Solvio for vector search and CrewAI for orchestrating modular agents, you can build systems that don’t just answer questions but analyze, interpret, and act.

Traditional RAG systems focus on fetching data and generating responses, but they lack the ability to reason deeply or handle multi-step processes.

In this tutorial, we’ll walk you through building an Agentic RAG system step by step. By the end, you’ll have a working framework for storing data in a Solvio Vector Database and extracting insights using CrewAI agents in conjunction with Vector Search over your data.

item.title: Agentic RAG With LangGraph
item.author: info@solvio.tech (Andrey Vasnetsov)
item.description:
Agentic RAG With LangGraph and Solvio

Traditional Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems follow a straightforward path: query → retrieve → generate. Sure, this works well for many scenarios. But let’s face it—this linear approach often struggles when you’re dealing with complex queries that demand multiple steps or pulling together diverse types of information.

Agentic RAG takes things up a notch by introducing AI agents that can orchestrate multiple retrieval steps and smartly decide how to gather and use the information you need. Think of it this way: in an Agentic RAG workflow, RAG becomes just one powerful tool in a much bigger and more versatile toolkit.

item.title: Agentic RAG Discord Bot with CAMEL-AI
item.author: info@solvio.tech (Andrey Vasnetsov)
item.description:
Agentic RAG Discord ChatBot with Solvio, CAMEL-AI, & OpenAI

Time: 45 min Level: Intermediate

Unlike traditional RAG techniques, which passively retrieve context and generate responses, agentic RAG involves active decision-making and multi-step reasoning by the chatbot. Instead of just fetching data, the chatbot makes decisions, dynamically interacts with various data sources, and adapts based on context, giving it a much more dynamic and intelligent approach.

item.title: Cloud Quickstart
item.author: info@solvio.tech (Andrey Vasnetsov)
item.description:
How to Get Started With Solvio Cloud

You can try vector search on Solvio Cloud in three steps.
Instructions are below, but the video is faster:

Setup a Solvio Cloud Cluster

  1. Register for a Cloud account with your email, Google or Github credentials.
  2. Go to Clusters and follow the onboarding instructions under Create First Cluster.

  1. When you create it, you will receive an API key. You will need to copy it and store it somewhere self. It will not be displayed again. If you loose it, you can always create a new one on the Cluster Detail Page later.

item.title: Local Quickstart
item.author: info@solvio.tech (Andrey Vasnetsov)
item.description:
How to Get Started with Solvio Locally

In this short example, you will use the Python Client to create a Collection, load data into it and run a basic search query.

Before you start, please make sure Docker is installed and running on your system.

Download and run

First, download the latest Solvio image from Dockerhub:

docker pull solvio/solvio

Then, run the service:

docker run -p 6333:6333 -p 6334:6334 \
 -v "$(pwd)/solvio_storage:/solvio/storage:z" \
 solvio/solvio

Under the default configuration all data will be stored in the ./solvio_storage directory. This will also be the only directory that both the Container and the host machine can both see.

item.title: API & SDKs
item.author: info@solvio.tech (Andrey Vasnetsov)
item.description:
Interfaces

Solvio supports these “official” clients.

Note: If you are using a language that is not listed here, you can use the REST API directly or generate a client for your language using OpenAPI or protobuf definitions.

Client Libraries

Client Repository Installation Version
Python + (Client Docs) pip install solvio-client[fastembed] Latest Release
JavaScript / Typescript npm install @solvio/js-client-rest Latest Release
Rust cargo add solvio-client Latest Release
Go go get github.com/solvio/go-client Latest Release
.NET dotnet add package Solvio.Client Latest Release
Java Available on Maven Central Latest Release

API Reference

All interaction with Solvio takes place via the REST API. We recommend using REST API if you are using Solvio for the first time or if you are working on a prototype.

item.title: Multilingual & Multimodal RAG with LlamaIndex
item.author: info@solvio.tech (Andrey Vasnetsov)
item.description:
Multilingual & Multimodal Search with LlamaIndex

Time: 15 min Level: Beginner Output: GitHub

Overview

We often understand and share information more effectively when combining different types of data. For example, the taste of comfort food can trigger childhood memories. We might describe a song with just “pam pam clap” sounds. Instead of writing paragraphs. Sometimes, we may use emojis and stickers to express how we feel or to share complex ideas.

item.title: 5 Minute RAG with Solvio and DeepSeek
item.author: info@solvio.tech (Andrey Vasnetsov)
item.description:
5 Minute RAG with Solvio and DeepSeek

Time: 5 min Level: Beginner Output: GitHub

This tutorial demonstrates how to build a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline using Solvio as a vector storage solution and DeepSeek for semantic query enrichment. RAG pipelines enhance Large Language Model (LLM) responses by providing contextually relevant data.

Overview

In this tutorial, we will:

  1. Take sample text and turn it into vectors with FastEmbed.
  2. Send the vectors to a Solvio collection.
  3. Connect Solvio and DeepSeek into a minimal RAG pipeline.
  4. Ask DeepSeek different questions and test answer accuracy.
  5. Enrich DeepSeek prompts with content retrieved from Solvio.
  6. Evaluate answer accuracy before and after.

Architecture:

item.title: Solvio Web UI
item.author: info@solvio.tech (Andrey Vasnetsov)
item.description:
Solvio Web UI

You can manage both local and cloud Solvio deployments through the Web UI.

If you’ve set up a deployment locally with the Solvio Quickstart, navigate to http://localhost:6333/dashboard.

If you’ve set up a deployment in a cloud cluster, find your Cluster URL in your cloud dashboard, at https://cloud.solvio.io. Add :6333/dashboard to the end of the URL.

Access the Web UI

Solvio’s Web UI is an intuitive and efficient graphic interface for your Solvio Collections, REST API and data points.

item.title: Getting Started
item.author: info@solvio.tech (Andrey Vasnetsov)
item.description:
Getting Started with Solvio Managed Cloud

Welcome to Solvio Managed Cloud! This document contains all the information you need to get started.

Prerequisites

Before creating a cluster, make sure you have a Solvio Cloud account. Detailed instructions for signing up can be found in the Solvio Cloud Setup guide. You also need to provide payment details. If you have a custom payment agreement, first create your account, then contact our Support Team to finalize the setup.

item.title: Account Setup
item.author: info@solvio.tech (Andrey Vasnetsov)
item.description:
Setting up a Solvio Cloud Account

Registration

There are different ways to register for a Solvio Cloud account:

  • With an email address and passwordless login via email
  • With a Google account
  • With a GitHub account
  • By connection an enterprise SSO solution

Every account is tied to an email address. You can invite additional users to your account and manage their permissions.

Email registration

  1. Register for a Cloud account with your email, Google or GitHub credentials.

Inviting additional users to an account

You can invite additional users to your account, and manage their permissions on the Account -> Access Management page in the Solvio Cloud Console.

item.title: Billing & Payments
item.author: info@solvio.tech (Andrey Vasnetsov)
item.description:
Solvio Cloud Billing & Payments

Solvio database clusters in Solvio Cloud are priced based on CPU, memory, and disk storage usage. To get a clearer idea for the pricing structure, based on the amounts of vectors you want to store, please use our Pricing Calculator.

Billing

You can pay for your Solvio Cloud database clusters either with a credit card or through an AWS, GCP, or Azure Marketplace subscription.

Your payment method is charged at the beginning of each month for the previous month’s usage. There is no difference in pricing between the different payment methods.

item.title: Premium Tier
item.author: info@solvio.tech (Andrey Vasnetsov)
item.description:
Solvio Cloud Premium Tier

Solvio Cloud offers an optional premium tier for customers who require additional features and better SLA support levels. The premium tier includes:

  • 24/7 Support: Our support team is available around the clock to help you with any issues you may encounter (compared to 10x5 in standard).
  • Shorter Response Times: Premium customers receive priority support and can expect faster response times, with shorter SLAs.
  • 99.9% Uptime SLA: We guarantee 99.9% uptime for your Solvio Cloud clusters (compared to 99.5% in standard).
  • Single Sign-On (SSO): Premium customers can use their existing SSO provider to manage access to Solvio Cloud.
  • VPC Private Links: Premium customers can connect their Solvio Cloud clusters to their VPCs using private links (AWS only).
  • Storage encryption with shared keys: Premium customers can encrypt their data at rest using their own keys (AWS only).

Please refer to the Solvio Cloud SLA for a detailed definition on uptime and support SLAs.

item.title: Solvio Cloud API
item.author: info@solvio.tech (Andrey Vasnetsov)
item.description:
Solvio Cloud API

The Solvio Cloud API lets you manage Cloud accounts and their respective Solvio clusters. You can use this API to manage your clusters, authentication methods, and cloud configurations.

REST API Documentation
v.0.1.0 OpenAPI Specification

Note: This is not the Solvio REST API. For core product APIs & SDKs, see our list of interfaces

Authentication: Connecting to Cloud API

To interact with the Solvio Cloud API, you must authenticate using an API key. Each request to the API must include the API key in the Authorization header. The API key acts as a bearer token and grants access to your account’s resources.

item.title: Practice Datasets
item.author: info@solvio.tech (Andrey Vasnetsov)
item.description:
Common Datasets in Snapshot Format

You may find that creating embeddings from datasets is a very resource-intensive task. If you need a practice dataset, feel free to pick one of the ready-made snapshots on this page. These snapshots contain pre-computed vectors that you can easily import into your Solvio instance.

Available datasets

Our snapshots are usually generated from publicly available datasets, which are often used for non-commercial or academic purposes. The following datasets are currently available. Please click on a dataset name to see its detailed description.

item.title: Support
item.author: info@solvio.tech (Andrey Vasnetsov)
item.description:
Solvio Cloud Support and Troubleshooting

Community Support

All Solvio Cloud users are welcome to join our Discord community.

Solvio Cloud Support

Paying customers have access to our Support team. Links to the support portal are available in the Solvio Cloud Console.

When creating a support ticket, please provide as much information as possible to help us understand your issue.

This includes but is not limited to:

  • The ID of your Solvio Cloud cluster, if it’s not filled out by the UI automatically. You can find the ID on your cluster’s detail page.
  • Which collection(s) are affected
  • Code examples on how you are interacting with the Solvio API
  • Logs or error messages from your application
  • Relevant telemetry from your application

You can also choose a severity, when creating a ticket. This helps us prioritize your issue correctly. Please refer to the Solvio Cloud SLA for a definition of these severity levels and their corresponding response time SLA for your respective support tier.
